snippet: Ms. Li’s work, having its New York debut at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, is mischievous, precise and full of whimsy, reaching beyond traditional dance audiences.
abstract: Blanca Li discusses technicalities involved in choreographing ROBOT, work illustrating convoluted relationship between humans and technology by mixing human dancers, NAO companion robots and mechanical orchestra.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Li’s work, having its New York debut at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, is mischievous, precise and full of whimsy, reaching beyond traditional dance audiences.

headline.main: In ‘ROBOT,’ Blanca Li Uses Machines to Celebrate the Body
headline.print_headline: Onstage With Energized Performers: They Really Are Dancing Machines
